15:55.race_name: Midnite A Next Generation Betting App Handicap

runners.comment: Well held here on both starts for this yard; new headgear combination needs to work
runners.name: Blue Sky Boy
runners.spotlight: Ten-race maiden who has finished down the field here on both starts since joining Tristan Davidson; needs a first-time hood and tongue-tie combination to spark a revival.

runners.comment: Not disgraced over C&D last twice; feasibly treated and likely to be in the mix
runners.name: Annandale
runners.spotlight: Respectable efforts over C&D on last two outings and now 4lb lower than when successful at Ayr last summer; likely to be in the mix.

runners.comment: 1m4f Kempton win in November; likely unsuited by shorter trip since; enters calculations
runners.name: Maywedance
runners.spotlight: Off the mark at the 13th attempt (dead-heated but awarded the race outright) in 1m4f Kempton handicap in November on final start for Alice Haynes; never involved over 9.4f at Wolverhampton for this yard since but should find this test more suitable; enters calculations.

runners.comment: Escapes penalty for last week's breakthrough Wolverhampton win; big shout if in same form
runners.name: V Power
runners.spotlight: Back from over five months off to shed maiden status in 1m6f Wolverhampton apprentice handicap ten days ago; escapes a penalty and well treated if coping with two outings in fairly quick succession after a break.

runners.breeder: Mrs A Cantillon & Mrs E McStay
runners.comment: Not disgraced in juvenile hurdles last twice and second in similar race last year
runners.name: Bouboule
runners.spotlight: Second in 1m4f Tapeta handicap off 2lb higher for Harry Derham last summer; never involved in 1m2f course handicap in early November on his first outing for Gillian Boanas but not disgraced in a couple of juvenile hurdles since; should have it in him to be competitive in race like this.

runners.comment: Low-mileage; second over 1m2f here latest; should go well if stamina holds up in trip
runners.name: Time Turner
runners.spotlight: Low-mileage 4yo who has made a solid start to his handicap career, finishing second over 1m2f here in a first-time visor (retained) 12 days ago; player now stepping up in trip.

runners.comment: Only sixth when favourite for recent handicap bow but evidently thought capable of better
runners.name: Saahir
runners.spotlight: Backed into favouritism for his 1m3f Kempton handicap debut 15 days ago but never seriously threatened in sixth; it'll be interesting to see whether his supporters are prepared to give this lightly raced sort another chance.

runners.comment: Well held over 7f/1m but longer trip bred to suit now handicapping in first-time headgear
runners.name: Hobgoblin
runners.spotlight: Well beaten in three qualifying runs over 7f/1m, latterly his yard debut after over a year off; now steps up markedly in trip (bred to stay) for handicap debut with cheekpieces also added; worth a look in the betting.

runners.comment: Close second over C&D in November but stopped quickly back here 15 days later
runners.name: Tracker Issue
runners.spotlight: First impact since joining Adam Nicol when beaten only a head over C&D in November but stopped quickly back here 15 days later; freshened up since.

runners.comment: 0-19 and wind op since last seen in October needs to spark improvement
runners.name: Millbuie
runners.owner: N J Dalgarno & W R Ellis
runners.spotlight: Exposed 19-race maiden; a wind operation since last seen in October will need to spark improvement if he's to get off the mark here.

16:25.race_name: BetMGM Supports Safer Gambling Restricted Novice Stakes (For horses In Bands B, C And D) (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Half-brother to useful winners and starts out in a winnable race;
runners.name: Dakota Breeze
runners.spotlight: Cost 50,000euros at last year's breeze-ups; half-brother to six winners, including useful pair Wasntexpectingthat (5f/6f including AW; RPR 99) and Itsakindamagic (1m AW; 91); starts out in a winnable race and market confidence would look significant.

runners.comment: Fair form, including second over 1m here 13 days ago; likely to go well
runners.name: Five Cay
runners.spotlight: Reached the frame in three of his four runs, including when second of five in a 1m course novice 13 days ago; looks pick of those with experience.

runners.comment: Showed a bit when fifth of eight on 6f course debut three weeks ago; may do better
runners.name: Stromness
runners.spotlight: 20/1, showed ability when fifth of eight on 6f course debut three weeks ago; may do better.

runners.comment: Gelded son of Calyx; yard can ready them but Callum Rodriguez is on stable's other runner
runners.name: Moon Bonce
runners.spotlight: Gelded son of Calyx; yard more than capable of readying one but Callum Rodriguez is on the stable's other runner.

runners.comment: Only minor promise in two recent outings over 1m here
runners.name: Red House
runners.spotlight: Has shown only minor in two recent 1m outings here under the care of Ann Duffield.

runners.comment: Green when well held on last week's C&D debut but should be more clued up now
runners.name: Star Of Emerald
runners.spotlight: Useful pedigree but green and never involved after a slow start on last week's C&D debut; should be wiser now and the fact he was 7-1 third favourite for that 11-runner race suggests he must have shown a bit at home.

runners.comment: Second over 7f at Ayr in September but only seventh twice since, including here
runners.name: Elizabetty
runners.owner: The Cat And The Mag Partnership
runners.spotlight: Looked to be progressing when second over 7f at Ayr but hasn't come close to reproducing that in two subsequent outings, including over 6f here three weeks ago; has hung left; bounce back needed.

runners.comment: Well beaten in course novices over 6f and 1m in recent weeks
runners.name: Freezing Havana
runners.spotlight: Well beaten in course novices over 6f and 1m in recent weeks; looks more one for handicaps after this.

17:00.race_name: Always Gamble Responsibly At BetMGM Handicap

runners.comment: Possible improver now handicapping for yard with good strike-rate here; check betting
runners.name: Aly AAli
runners.spotlight: Had three qualifying runs over 6f in August/September, improving her RPR each time; fitted with cheekpieces now dropping to 5f for her handicap debut after four months off; yard has a healthy strike-rate here and it'll interesting to see what the betting makes of her.

runners.comment: Only sixth of 13 on recent 6f Kempton handicap but drop to 6f may suit this free-goer
runners.name: Ya Habibti
runners.spotlight: No significant impact when sixth of 13 on 6f Kempton handicap debut a fortnight ago but it's possible this drop to the minimum trip could suit this free-goer.

runners.comment: Fourth in two course handicaps; only had five starts so may not have reached his limit
runners.name: Mystical Land
runners.spotlight: Fourth in two course handicaps last month; not beaten far dropped to 5f latterly; only had five starts so may not have reached his limit.

runners.comment: Hasn't built on 6f course win in blinkers but new headgear (visor) could work well
runners.name: The Tunguska Event
runners.spotlight: Left his maiden/novice form behind him when running away with a 6f course nursery in first-time blinkers in November; hasn't come close to backing that up twice since but there's nothing wrong with that winning form (second won next time) and possible that new headgear (visor) and a drop back to 5f could spark a revival.

runners.comment: Second to improvers in 6f Southwell h'caps last twice; player if as effective back at 5f
runners.name: Mademoiselle Belle
runners.spotlight: 0-10 but has run well when going down only to a pair of improvers in 6f Southwell handicaps in recent weeks; big shout if as effective back at 5f.

runners.comment: Now 0-16 but this much more realistic than C&D novice she contested on Tuesday
runners.name: Havin A Flyer
runners.spotlight: 16-race maiden, although C&D third in December shows she can be competitive from her mark; this much more realistic than the C&D novice she contested on Tuesday; the first-time tongue-tie worn on that occasion is retained.

runners.comment: Well held in four turf runs last year, including handicap; makes AW debut after break
runners.name: Contorno
runners.spotlight: Soundly beaten in four turf starts last year, including 6f Redcar handicap debut in September; switches to AW for the first time after four months off; needs improvement.

runners.comment: Jason Hart on yard's other runner but this handicap newcomer still needs a betting check
runners.name: Amazon Jungle
runners.spotlight: Always behind in three outings last summer but allotted a basement mark as a result and his pedigree provides the hope for better this year; Jason Hart is on stablemate The Tunguska Event but this one is still worth a look in the betting.

runners.comment: Dead-heated on 7f AW debut in October; held at Kempton since but could bounce back
runners.name: Angel Hunter
runners.spotlight: Dual winner on turf and forced a dead heat when tackling AW for the first time at Southwell (7f) in October; unable to reproduce that level at Kempton last month but the yard's good recent form provides the hope for better back on Tapeta.

runners.comment: Back on same mark as when winning here last march but needs to step up on recent efforts
runners.name: Nikovo
runners.spotlight: Three-time course winner who is back off the same mark as when successful over 7f last March; needs to improve on recent efforts, though.

runners.comment: Hard not to be impressed by ready defeat of next-time-out winner latest
runners.name: Bridgets View
runners.spotlight: Very lightly raced 4yo who made an impressive winning return from another break when easily seeing off last week's comfortable course scorer Stateira over 1m at Southwell six weeks ago; even a 10lb rise may not stop her.

runners.comment: Good second at Kempton latest and this dual C&D scorer merits plenty of respect
runners.name: Dingle
runners.spotlight: Returned from a break to finish a good second at Kempton (1m) five weeks ago; has a particularly good record there but he's also a dual C&D scorer; should give another good account.

runners.comment: Solid Tapeta record, including third over 1m at Southwell 19 days ago
runners.name: Tribal Wisdom
runners.spotlight: Has form figures of 1411433 on Tapeta since October, with the latest third coming over this trip at Southwell 19 days ago; no reason why he won't give his running again.

runners.comment: Turf win for Ralph Beckett in October but struggled in two AW handicaps for new yard since
runners.name: Helmsley
runners.spotlight: Easy win in 1m Redcar novice for Ralph Beckett in October; changed hands for 45,000gns soon after and well held in two AW handicaps for new yard; the handicapper has cut her some slack but it's still likely best to look elsewhere.

runners.comment: Reliable on AW but doesn't obviously have much in hand of his mark
runners.name: Urban Road
runners.owner: S McMillan F Reay & A D Brown
runners.spotlight: Five-time course winner who has continued to run well since completing a hat-trick on Tapeta last February, including when third over 1m2f here on New Year's Day; will need to find a bit extra to get his head back in front, though.

runners.comment: Consistent since 7f course success last month but might be vulnerable for win here
runners.name: Bajan Bandit
runners.spotlight: Consistent since winning off 4lb lower over 7f here in early December, including third of seven over C&D nine days ago; this is a higher grade than he needs to contest, though, and he's due to be 1lb lower from the weekend.

18:00.race_name: Win £250,000 With BetMGM's Golden Goals Handicap

runners.comment: No significant impact in handicaps last year and others are more persuasive
runners.name: The Caddy Master
runners.spotlight: Unable to make a significant impact in three handicaps last year; dips into a 0-60 for the first time back from three months off but others are more obvious.

runners.comment: Showed ability in three 6f starts here last month and possible improver in handicaps
runners.name: Quiet Serenade
runners.spotlight: Caught the eye on the second of three quick qualifying runs over 6f here last month and rates a potential improver now handicapping up in trip.

runners.comment: Dead-heated over C&D last month; too free when only seventh at Wolverhamptron since
runners.name: Surgeon Commander
runners.spotlight: Dead-heated in C&D nursery last month, with the reopposing Runninman close up in third; too free when well beaten at Wolverhampton (7f again) since.

runners.comment: 7f Lingfield win fortnight ago and too free over 1m there last week; worth another chance
runners.name: Giles Glory
runners.spotlight: Rewarded strong market support back from a gelding operation when asserting late on at Lingfield (7f) a fortnight ago; raced too freely out wide when only fourth over 1m there last week; worth another chance back at 7f with first-time cheekpieces (replacing visor) combined with the tongue-tie this time.

runners.comment: No significant impact in four handicaps, including Wolverhampton on Monday
runners.name: Maynora
runners.spotlight: Yet to make a significant impact in handicaps after four attempts, including over 7f at Wolverhampton in cheekpieces (retained) on Monday.

runners.comment: Well held all three starts and even mark of 53 demands plenty of improvement
runners.name: Fickle McSelfish
runners.spotlight: Well held in three qualifying runs this winter; more chance now handicapping but it's hard to argue even a mark of 53 looks generous

runners.comment: Beaten only a head when third over C&D latest and considered from same mark
runners.name: Runninman
runners.spotlight: Third in course nurseries in November/December, going down by only a head over this trip latterly; Stephen Hanlon has already had a winner since taking over the licence from Ann Duffield; considered.

18:30.race_name: Midnite Ain't Your Grandad's Bookie Handicap

runners.comment: Looked useful when winning C&D maiden and Wolver novice in late 2025; leading claims
runners.name: Night Storm
runners.spotlight: Absent for 15 months after finished well held on his turf debut but showed why connections have persevered with 5f AW maiden/novice wins in November/December (here first occasion); up against some battle-hardened types on handicap debut but there could be plenty more to come.

runners.breeder: R F And S D Knipe
runners.comment: Won two C&D handicaps for Bryan Smart early last year but off since; betting should guide
runners.name: Buzz Box
runners.spotlight: Improved to win two C&D handicaps early last year; looked capable of even better but not seen since; new yard (same owner) among the winners and it'll be interesting to see what the betting makes of him.

runners.comment: C&D win on sole AW start and returns from a 104-day break off a dangerous mark
runners.name: Vantheman
runners.spotlight: Useful sort whose sole AW start resulted in a C&D win on his 2024 reappearance; operating a little below his best when last seen in the autumn but his mark has dropped as a result (now 6lb lower than when second at Hamilton last summer); capable of going well.

runners.comment: Feasibly treated back from break as he was second over C&D off 6lb higher on 2025 return
runners.name: Ventura Express
runners.spotlight: Ended last year on a low note but finished runner-up over C&D off 6lb higher on his 2025 reappearance so a revival can't be ruled out back from a 110-day break.

runners.comment: C&D win number three on New Year's Day but lsat of give back here since
runners.name: Kings Crown
runners.spotlight: Three C&D wins, the latest on New Year's Day; a 3lb rise proved enough to find him out back here last week, though.

runners.comment: Unplaced all six AW runs but was bit better than sixth suggests on 6f course yard debut
runners.name: Pop Star
runners.spotlight: Four-time turf winner; unplaced on all six AW starts but he did make headway before shaping as if his first outing for 112 days was possibly needed when sixth of ten over 6f here on yard debut at the end of December.

runners.comment: Some good efforts since yard debut turf win in autumn but latest course seventh below par
runners.name: Arnhem
runners.spotlight: Made a winning stable debut at Haydock (5f) in September; several good efforts have followed, including here, but latest 6f course seventh was a little disappointing.

runners.breeder: Mr & Mrs P Hopper & Mr & Mrs M Morris
runners.comment: Ten turf wins but took AW record to 0-11 when well held at Southwell latest
runners.name: Glory Fighter
runners.spotlight: Veteran who has won ten times on turf but took his AW record to 0-11 when down the field at Southwell 16 days ago; others are more persuasive.

19:00.race_name: Read Meg Nicholls' Blog At betmgm.co.uk Handicap

runners.comment: Opened AW account over 6f here in December but handicapper in charge since
runners.name: Judgment Call
runners.owner: Paul Corrigan & Miss L A Perratt
runners.spotlight: Opened his AW account in 6f course handicap in December, ending a long losing run; not disgraced in his three outings since but others are preferred for win purposes.

runners.comment: Mostly respectable efforts since edging out Judgement Call over C&D in September
runners.name: Novak
runners.spotlight: Edged out Judgement Call over C&D in September; mainly respectable efforts since and he's dipped to 1lb below that latest win mark; should be in the shake-up.

runners.comment: C&D win in December, his 17th career success; fair third back here since
runners.name: Bobby Joe Leg
runners.spotlight: Career win number 17 when holding on narrowly over C&D in December; respectable third of six over C&D just after Christmas and Tom Kiely-Marshall takes 5lb off his back this time.

runners.comment: Two turf wins earlier in career but yet to make major impact in handicaps; off 168 days
runners.name: Golden Strike
runners.spotlight: Won maiden and novice over 6f on turf; hasn't come close to reproducing those efforts in handicaps, although latest fifth of 13 at  Chepstow (7f) in August came in a competitive Racing League event; off 168 days.

runners.comment: C&D win last month; close third next time and excuses latest
runners.name: Flowstate
runners.spotlight: Off the mark over C&D last month; close third at Wolverhampton (7f again) next time and caught too far back in a race where the pace held up at the same venue last week (treated as if still in form).

runners.comment: Two 6f course wins in December; good second over C&D 12 days ago; likely to go well again
runners.name: Goldmoyne
runners.spotlight: Yet another to benefit from the switch to the prolific James Owen yard, landing a pair of 6f course handicaps last month; couldn't complete a hat-trick but bettered those winning RPRs when second of 11 over C&D 12 days ago; likely to go well again.

runners.comment: Fifth course win last month and good second to Aisling Oscar over C&D on Tuesday
runners.name: Tasever
runners.spotlight: Five course wins, the latest over 1m last month; bounced back quickly from a lesser effort when chasing home Aisling Oscar here (1m again) on Tuesday; 5lb better off with that rival now but it may not be enough.

runners.comment: Plenty of creditable efforts on AW but his wait for a first win may go on
runners.name: Jamaican Storm
runners.spotlight: Placed for a fifth time on Tapeta when third of 12 at Southwell (7f) 18 days ago but this looks a warm race for the grade and suspicion his wait for a first win may go on.

runners.comment: Second C&D win in November but behind Goldmoyne and Concert Boy here latest
runners.name: Front Gunner
runners.spotlight: Ex-Ann Duffield; gained a second C&D success in November; backed it up with a solid third of 12 over C&D in December but latest C&D fifth (Goldmoyne second, Concert Boy third) was no more than respectable.

runners.comment: 1m course win last month; creditable third over C&D latest but Goldmoyne ahead in second
runners.name: Concert Boy
runners.owner: Making Headway Racing And K Scott
runners.spotlight: Signed off 2025 with an impressive 1m course win and two creditable in-frame efforts have followed, although the reopposing Goldmoyne was 1l ahead in second last time; likely to be on the premises again.

runners.comment: Completed course six-timer on Tuesday; 5lb penalty may not stop him making it seven in row
runners.name: Aisling Oscar
runners.spotlight: Completed a course six-timer since joining Adrian Keatley when pushed out to see off Tasever over 1m on Tuesday; did that a cosily and the one to beat again despite a 5lb penalty.

runners.comment: Goes well here but Aisling Oscar was too strong last week and it may be the same again
runners.name: Wyvern
runners.spotlight: Two more course wins towards the end of 2025, latterly over this trip; another good effort when chasing home Aisling Oscar over C&D last week; likely to give another account but that's not to say he can turn the tables on Adrian Keatley's charge even on 5lb better terms.

12:28.race_name: Pertemps Network Novices' Handicap Chase (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Ran well on last month's handicap hurdle debut and might have more to offer now chasing
runners.name: Tree Top Tyson
runners.spotlight: 1-6 over hurdles, the win gained in a three-runner Sedgefield maiden (2m1f, good) in October; ran well before fading into fifth on last month's handicap debut at Catterick (2m3f, good) and has some slow-ground pointing experience to call upon on this chasing debut.

runners.comment: 0-3 over fences but gave very good account when fourth in recent 0-130 contest at Haydock
runners.name: Kahavari
runners.spotlight: Made shaky start to chasing career in the autumn but gave very good account when fourth in 0-130 contest at Haydock (2m4f, good to soft) last month; probably copes with soft ground and can be very dangerous in this lower grade if suited by the drop back in trip; tongue-tie added.

runners.comment: Dual hurdle winner last spring but has not really convinced over fences this term
runners.name: Synchronist
runners.spotlight: Won two handicap hurdles (2m, good to soft/good) towards end of last season but has not really convinced on his three chasing starts this term, with best run coming in race in which half the fences were omitted; the forecast ground here might be slower than ideal; others preferred.

runners.comment: Scored over C&D just before Christmas and should be fine on the slower ground today
runners.name: Touquet
runners.spotlight: Last year wasn't all plain sailing but he delivered on previous chasing promise when scoring over C&D (good to soft; first-time tongue-tie) just before Christmas and should be fine on the slower ground today; respected.

runners.comment: Off the mark over fences at Lingfield last month and holds Touquet on that form
runners.name: A Great Excuse
runners.spotlight: Low-mileage 6yo who built upon encouraging seasonal/chase/stable debut when keeping on strongly to lead on run-in at Lingfield (2m, good to soft) last month; holds Touquet on that form and has plenty of scope for further progress; tongue-tie added.

runners.breeder: E A R L Haras Du Grand Courgeon
runners.comment: 0-12 under all codes but made pretty good start to chasing career with third at Leicester
runners.name: Plantaroma
runners.spotlight: 0-12 under all codes but made pretty good start to chasing career when third in race won by progressive subsequent winner at Leicester (2m, good; also suited by soft) last month and is 2lb lower here; a possible.

runners.comment: First two chasing runs were very respectable but he'd appeal more on good ground
runners.name: Sanitiser
runners.spotlight: Versatile 7yo who seemed to take fairly well to fences when fourth twice in November (2m3f/2m); needs the refitted blinkers to help him find something extra here, though, and he'd appeal more on good ground.

12:58.race_name: Pertemps Network Maiden Hurdle (Novices' Championship Hurdle Series Qualifier) (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Checked out quickly over C&D (bumper, hurdle) the last twice; wind operation since.
runners.name: Bobajob
runners.spotlight: Looked promising on November 2024's bumper debut second, but has checked out sharply on two tries over this C&D since (bumper, novice hurdle); tongue-tie and wind operation need to prove transformative.

runners.comment: Near-miss in Carlisle Flat handicap in July (2m1f, soft) but below par since; hurdles bow.
runners.name: Different Drum
runners.spotlight: Below par on the Flat since July's Carlisle class 5 near-miss over a longer trip than awaits in this new discipline; unpersuasive.

runners.comment: Last of six on bumper debut and struggling a long way out switched to hurdles latest.
runners.name: Dino Moon
runners.spotlight: Last of six on bumper debut and struggling a long way out switched to hurdles latest (beaten 77l); hard to warm to at present.

runners.comment: Matched his previous best form when fourth in a Grade 2 latest; that sets the standard.
runners.name: Double Measure
runners.spotlight: Refusal to settle and a mid-race error made his task even harder in a Haydock Grade 2 latest (2m, good to soft); still ran there to the level of his previous Chepstow near-miss behind Winter Hurdle second The Blue Room (with Holloway's winner Came From Nowhere 25l adrift), easily the best form on offer in this field.

runners.comment: C&D maiden third of hurdling debut not built on latest; maybe one for handicaps soon.
runners.name: Hans Lippershey
runners.spotlight: Progressive in bumpers and laid down a fair marker in another C&D maiden on hurdling debut (hooded), but no further progress at Kempton latest in an admittedly likely better race; maybe one for handicaps.

runners.breeder: Dr V Emmanuel Boutin Et Al
runners.comment: Inconclusive hurdles debut having refused to settle, but 2-2 (bumper, point) previously.
runners.name: Jorah dAlma
runners.spotlight: Inconclusive hurdles debut latest having refused to settle, but he'd showed a determined attitude in his Ludlow bumper win and the form of his earlier Irish point success has substance; may yet do better.

runners.comment: Merely consolidated previous hurdles form on Lingfield sixth latest; more needed again.
runners.name: Kado Sacree
runners.spotlight: Irish point winner (3m, soft); consolidated form level of promising Exeter hurdles debut fourth rather than building on it at Lingfield latest, weakening late; lesser claims of the Murphy pair.

runners.comment: Okay fourth on Irish point start; not the appeal of some until sent handicapping.
runners.name: Laios Tresor
runners.spotlight: Okay fourth on Irish point start; encouragement for 2m over jumps on pedigree; new yard isn't a ready source of novice/maiden winners.

runners.comment: French 1m4f winner (soft) when last seen 21 months ago; jumps winners in near family.
runners.name: Limier dArthel
runners.spotlight: Cosy winner of his final start for Emmanuel Clayeux, a 1m4f AQPS race at Moulins (soft); nephew and half-brother of French jumps winners at this sort of trip, and only the 21-month absence concerns at all.

runners.comment: Gifted soft lead for bumper win; need to forgive high head carriage of hurdling debut.
runners.name: Loustic Du Chatel
runners.spotlight: Form of November's Ascot bumper win needs treating with caution (rider gifted the softest of leads), and have to hope his high head carriage on hurdling debut was owed to either greenness or a resentment of the now-removed hood; present attainment level thus still unclear.

runners.comment: Eyecatching 14l fourth on Hereford debut, and will be more streetwise this time.
runners.name: Lully Du Houx
runners.spotlight: Ended his Hereford debut a far wiser horse than he started it, beaten 14l but keeping on with purpose; something to find on the figures with the best of these, but good step forward seems highly likely.

runners.comment: Bare details of last-time Sandown second disguise a 55l defeat; others persuade more.
runners.name: Night Ride Home
runners.owner: M Buckley C Noell And M Hankin
runners.spotlight: The RPR of 104 for November's 13l Newcastle fifth (2m1f, good to soft; weakened last) is a bit of an outlier, and his Sandown second since was a remote one; others are that bit more persuasive.

runners.comment: Beaten under 1l at Uttoxeter latest (2m, heavy); live claims if there's more improvement.
runners.name: Pertemps
runners.spotlight: Represents the sponsors; improved from first run to second in bumpers and did likewise when beaten under 1l on his latest hurdling outing at Uttoxeter (heavy), albeit flattered a little by the proximity; sharper 2m not strictly a plus, but live claims still if more improvement forthcoming.

runners.comment: From family of smart 2m hurdler Spirit Leader; half-brother won races for this trainer.
runners.name: Sims Law
runners.spotlight: 21,000euros foal; half-brother Coeur Serein won four for the O'Neills, including a 3m1f hurdle here, whilst the granddam was a sister to County Hurdle/Tote Gold Trophy heroine Spirit Leader; check for market clues.

runners.comment: Beaten favourite in two 2m4f maiden points (good); drop in trip makes sense; rules debut.
runners.name: The Den Master
runners.spotlight: Unable to last home having made the running in two good-ground 2m4f maiden points for the Andrews/Ellis family, a beaten favourite in each; drop in trip for rules debut makes sense but others inspire more.

runners.comment: Doesn't always settle or stay 1m on the Flat, giving rise to stamina worries over hurdles.
runners.name: Papa Oscar
runners.spotlight: Doesn't always settle or stay 1m on the Flat (failed to again latest); uncertain he'll last even this sharp 2m over hurdles; hood back.

runners.comment: Windsor run latest (3m, good) was his best in a while, but re-raised 6lb for not winning.
runners.name: Limetree Boy
runners.spotlight: Recent Windsor second (3m, good; pair 13l clear) was his most likeable performance since last spring; effective on slow ground and over stayers' trips, but untried over both together, and cranked back up 6lb also.

runners.comment: First chasing completion when winning at Market Rasen latest (3m); 5lb rise looks fair.
runners.name: Orange Diamond
runners.spotlight: Record of PPPPF over fences in 2023-24 but travelled strongly and mostly jumped fine returned to them at Market Rasen on Boxing Day (3m, good to soft), he and the runner-up pulling 17l and more clear; this is a warmer 0-100, but a 5lb rise isn't prohibitive next to his recent RPRs.

runners.comment: Holding form well in chases, if over shorter and on ground quicker than today's may be.
runners.name: Moor End
runners.owner: Mr & Mrs Aj Mutch & Mrs Ej Bishop
runners.spotlight: Holding his form nicely despite the 4lb rise for October's Uttoxeter chase debut win (2m4f, good to soft); effectiveness on slow ground hasn't been tested since April 2024, and form figures beyond 2m5f read P56.

runners.comment: Defied 616-day absence at Ludlow off this mark last week; 8lb well in and chance obvious.
runners.name: Annie Express
runners.spotlight: Ground easier than for previous chases when defying a 616-day absence off this mark on last week's Ludlow stable debut (3m), albeit against some deeply fallible rivals; 8lb well in, and player if this doesn't come too soon.

runners.comment: Lowered this mark in a Southwell hurdle (3m, soft) the only time he's tried to make all.
runners.name: Call Me Arthur
runners.spotlight: Temporary switch to front-running over a sharp 3m netted him a Southwell hurdle off this mark in May 2024 (soft), but rather lost in the crowd in big-field chases on only two starts since; tongue tie off.

runners.comment: Interesting if settling better than on last month's C&D chase return from a big layoff.
runners.name: Theres Claude
runners.spotlight: Refusal to settle on first start for over 22 months inevitably caught up with him on last month's chase/handicap debut over C&D; needs to help himself more, but already okay mark lowered 3lb more; tongue tie added.

runners.comment: No prizes for consistency, and below par latest; not convinced he definitely needs 3m.
runners.name: Lord Maher
runners.spotlight: Looking good for a place when brought down late at Fontwell two starts ago, but typically failed to back up that effort last time; hasn't obviously been crying out for this step up to around 3m; visor removed.

runners.comment: 2m7f hurdles winner before follow-up bid came too soon; moderate chasing record hitherto.
runners.name: Hardy Buck
runners.spotlight: Exeter hurdles winner (2m7f) on stable debut in November, before finding the follow-up bid coming too soon; still at the right end of the weights to improve on a chasing record of 649FP67, all for other yards.

runners.comment: Best ever RPR came in a C&D 0-100 over two years ago; well below par so far this term.
runners.name: Honneur De Sivola
runners.spotlight: Peak RPR of 98 came in an identical C&D event over two years ago (good); 0-8 since, however, with a breakthrough rules win seeming further away than ever on this season's efforts; 2lb out of the weights.

runners.comment: No improvement yet for the switch to fences this season; 8lb out of the weights here.
runners.name: Voleur De Terres
runners.spotlight: Beaten 41l or more when completing under rules, the switch to fences yet to offer fresh hope; 8lb out of the weights here.

14:05.race_name: Pertemps Network Mares' Handicap Chase (Challenger Mares' Chase Series Qualifier) (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Tidy 5l sixth in a superior mares' handicap at Cheltenham latest; ground is sole issue.
runners.name: Batwomen
runners.spotlight: Almost denied Easy To Follow in a heavy-ground hurdle once, but best figures win or lose have been returned on no worse than the good to soft of last month's tidy 5l sixth in a Cheltenham mares' 0-125; still early days for her as a chaser, appears to jump fine and holds strong claims.

runners.comment: Beat Batwomen in late 2023 but winless since; not sure 3m or cheekpieces are the answer.
runners.name: Easy To Follow
runners.spotlight: No further successes since beating Batwomen by a neck in a Fontwell mares' novice hurdle in December 2023 (2m3f, heavy); mixed signals over fences of late as to whether this step up to 3m is needed, and cheekpieces wrought no improvement from her on one previous application.

runners.comment: Limited form in the past three years, but connections keeping faith; lost a shoe latest.
runners.name: Flowing Cadenza
runners.spotlight: Dual soft-ground winner either side of Christmas 2022-23 (3m1f, 3m2f); limited form in just three starts in the past three years, though might just have gone closer but for losing a shoe latest.

runners.comment: Irish point and Exeter mares' maiden hurdle winner; tough mark for chase/handicap debut.
runners.name: Wheres Cato
runners.spotlight: Form of last February's Irish point win looks better now following runner-up White Noise's recent British hurdling hat-trick; not much of an Exeter mares' maiden hurdle she won in October, however, and limitations exposed since; starts life over fences and in handicaps on a tough mark.

14:40.race_name: Albert Bartlett Triple Crown Series Handicap Hurdle (Qualifier)

runners.comment: 10l third on handicap debut at Lingfield (2m7f, good to soft) was after a lengthy absence
runners.name: Duffry Trixs
runners.spotlight: 2m3f maiden winner and his 10l third on handicap debut at Lingfield (2m7f, good to soft) was after a lengthy absence; if fitter here then could get more competitive.

runners.comment: Easy winner of this last year and possibilities if back on song in new cheekpieces
runners.name: Gold For Alec
runners.spotlight: 7lb higher than for last year's win in this race but that was by 6l and was placed off 1lb higher at Cheltenham in October; poor in his last three races, though the last two were over fences; possibilities if back on song in new cheekpieces.

runners.breeder: E A R L Haras Du Camp Benard
runners.comment: Generally disappointing since completing a hat-trick in early 2024
runners.name: Royal Way
runners.spotlight: Progressive in early 2024 when completing a hat-trick on handicap debut at Ascot; generally disappointing since and was only third of four on Sandown reappearance (first run after wind surgery).

runners.breeder: Dr V Ana Sofia Dias Trindade & Tim Lane
runners.comment: Fell midrace when bidding for a handicap hat-trick at Haydock; did go off favourite
runners.name: Nazare
runners.spotlight: Won over about 2m4f on good to soft at Market Rasen and Southwell (by a neck) in his first two handicaps; went up 4lb for the latest but was favourite at Haydock last month and fell midrace; unraced on soft ground but respected.

runners.comment: Third at Market Rasen last time when he made a mistake at just the wrong time
runners.name: The Long Walk
runners.spotlight: Maiden winner over 2m3f; pulled up on handicap debut but ran better at Market Rasen (2m2f) where he made a mistake at just the wrong time; possibilities.

runners.comment: Has low mileage but absent since the spring and best form has been on good ground
runners.name: Escapologist
runners.spotlight: Won a 2m4f maiden on stable/hurdle debut about a year ago and probably bettered that performance when close second back at Fakenham (also on good ground) a few weeks later; not quite in same form in handicaps elsewhere in the spring and there are some doubts about him on soft ground.

runners.comment: Dual novice winner; struggled in two handicaps and seemingly neglected by Harry Skelton
runners.name: Service Minimum
runners.spotlight: 2m4f novice winner in August but has since suffered heavy defeats in handicaps and Harry Skelton rides the yard's other one.

runners.comment: First blip was last time and soft ground perhaps a factor; ability needs respecting
runners.name: Lundi Noir
runners.spotlight: Won a 2m maiden on debut (good to soft) and even better form when third in his first handicap at Chepstow (good); went off the 2-1 favourite back there months ago and soft ground could have been a factor, having bypassed a race on account of similar conditions the time before; ability is respected, however.

runners.comment: Tailed off at Cheltenham last time, in handicap and novice company; this is easier
runners.name: Cant Resist It
runners.spotlight: Never landed a blow when an outsider for a Cheltenham novice hurdle in December that was won by Supreme favourite Old Park Star; also tailed off in a handicap there the run before; however, his placed form previously offers some hope off this sort of mark.

runners.comment: Early days with current yard but beaten 11.5l on return to hurdles in August
runners.name: A Mere Bagatelle
runners.spotlight: Four wins for Shark Hanlon divided between hurdles/fences; respectable Flat efforts for James Owen before an 11.5l defeat on return to hurdling at Worcester (in this new headgear combination); will need to better than form here back from 144 days off.

runners.comment: Too free last time at Kempton (3m); back in trip and possibly on a fair mark
runners.name: Ive Madeupmymind
runners.spotlight: Made all for Bangor maiden win (2m, heavy) last February; had every chance when falling on her reappearance (3m handicap) and was too free for comfort at Kempton over Christmas, again at 3m; probably on a fair mark and she's back in trip; chance.

runners.comment: Encouraging debut under rules and faced with heavy ground last time; handicap debut
runners.name: Northanger Abbey
runners.spotlight: Folded tamely in his latest maiden (1m7f, heavy) but ran perfectly well the time before on his rules debut and he goes handicapping at a realistic level.

runners.comment: Pulled hard under different handling last time and can be given another chance
runners.name: Low Expectations
runners.spotlight: Under James Davies he went 3-3 in 2m-2m4f handicaps following a break; up the weights but he pulled hard under different handling last time and can be given another chance.

runners.comment: Beaten between 18l and 31l in a bumper and two runs over hurdles (2m/2m3f)
runners.name: Hidden Target
runners.spotlight: Beaten between 18l and 31l in a bumper and two runs over hurdles (2m/2m3f); hard to be confident ahead of this handicap debut.

runners.comment: Good second at Fontwell in November but lesser performances have followed
runners.name: Moab
runners.spotlight: Good second at Fontwell in November but lesser performances have followed, though did run at Ascot last time (33-1); others look more likely.

runners.comment: Narrow winner here on handicap debut (good to soft); softer ground is of some concern
runners.name: Albie Littlewood
runners.spotlight: Half-brother to the stable's Grade 1 winner Roksana; won only narrowly on his handicap debut over slightly shorter here (good to soft) but was strong in the market and strong in the finish after travelling well; no doubt has more to give but has been withdrawn from races on account of soft ground on two occasions, which is a nagging concern.

runners.comment: Back to form when beaten 3l over C&D in November but only eighth on his return visit
runners.name: Bread And Butter
runners.spotlight: Back to form when beaten 3l over C&D in November but only eighth on his return visit; an 11yo now and can be taken on.

15:15.race_name: Pertemps Network Handicap Hurdle (Series Qualifier) (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Latest Cheltenham defeat was no backward step as the winner is going places
runners.name: Ace Of Spades
runners.spotlight: Progressive handicapper who stayed on well for second in a Class 2 at Cheltenham three weeks ago (3m, good; effective on good to soft; unraced on slower) and the winner is due to run in this weekend's Grade 2 Cleeve Hurdle; every chance despite the 4lb rise.

runners.comment: Interesting to see what the market makes of him now back with Nicky Henderson
runners.name: Bold Endeavour
runners.spotlight: Back with Nicky Henderson for whom he was fourth in the 2024 Pertemps Final at Cheltenham off a 13lb higher mark; got nothing going in three races for Laura Morgan, the latest 12 months ago; clearly has a lot to prove now, but interesting to see what the market makes of him.

runners.comment: Challenging when falling late on at Kempton; 3lb higher and with stamina to prove
runners.name: Onewaywest
runners.spotlight: Won 2m3f handicaps at Warwick and Wetherby (both on soft) despite jumping out to his right and, although headed, was still in contention when crashing out at the final flight at Kempton on Boxing Day (2m5f, good); raised an annoying 3lb for that and has stamina to prove over this far, but he's a 7yo on the rise.

runners.comment: On a tough mark but there's hope that he could improve for this longer distance
runners.name: Don Virginia
runners.spotlight: 16lb higher than for his wide-margin win at Worcester in September (2m4f, good), after which he ran in a Cheltenham novice; pleasing fourth back in handicap company at Newbury but it's looking as though the handicapper is in charge; his breeding offers hope for him staying this longer trip.

runners.comment: Second run back from a layoff when winning comfortably at Warwick; unexposed as a stayer
runners.name: Benign Dictator
runners.spotlight: Second run back from a long layoff when winning comfortably at Warwick (3m2f, good to soft; 6lb lower) and that was his first run beyond 3m; lightly raced for a 9yo and firmly enters the reckoning.

runners.breeder: S C E A De Maulde Et Al
runners.comment: On a good mark if as good as he was and the betting should be informative
runners.name: Loup De Maulde
runners.spotlight: Absent since March 2024 but was on the top of his game back then in winning back-to-back chases over trips just shy of 3m here and at Taunton; on a handy mark if as good as he was and the betting should be informative.

runners.comment: Dual hurdle/bumper winner on soft/heavy and could be happy to see the back of fences
runners.name: Sole Solution
runners.spotlight: Dual hurdle/bumper winner on soft/heavy ground and could be happy to see the back of fences (last two runs); he's not handicapped out of it.

15:48.race_name: Pertemps Network Mares' Maiden National Hunt Flat Race (Conditional & Amateurs) (Cat 3) (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Fourth at Hereford on rules debut; well bred and remains open to progress
runners.name: Affric Kintail
runners.spotlight: Has made the frame in two Irish points and a Hereford bumper, staying-on fourth of 14 latest (2m, good); well bred and remains open to progress; enters calculations.

runners.comment: Not an obvious bumper type on breeding
runners.name: Briery Bluebelle
runners.owner: Mrs Helen Plumbly & Mrs Amanda Mantell
runners.spotlight: Dam smart 2m4f hurdle/chase winner, half-sister to three winners over jumps; this newcomer is not an obvious bumper type on breeding.

runners.comment: From a good family and should improve on her Warwick effort
runners.name: Elated
runners.spotlight: From a good family; finished fifth of 13 at Warwick, eventually running out of steam having been up there for a long way; likely to improve with the outing under her belt.

runners.comment: Absent since promising third at Worcester in July 2024; market useful
runners.name: Emerald Quest
runners.spotlight: Absent since promising third of 12 at Worcester (2m, good) in July 2024; now goes in tongue-tie; a form contender but the market signals may prove best guide.

runners.comment: Solid second in Irish point and Ludlow bumper; winner waiting to happen
runners.name: For A Moment
runners.spotlight: Solid second to Malina Road in Irish point and Ludlow bumper (2m, good to soft); that mare, a stablemate, has subsequently bagged Listed honours; winner waiting to happen.

runners.comment: £7,000 yearling; yard 0-10 in bumpers this term
runners.name: Lady Bamburgh
runners.spotlight: £7,000 yearling; dam French 2m hurdle winner, half-sister to useful 2m3f-2m6f jumps winner Farceur Du Large; yard 0-10 in bumpers this term.

runners.comment: Second of two finishers in both attempts in Irish points
runners.name: Lady Blackmore
runners.spotlight: Second of two finishers in both attempts in Irish points; new stable also runs Affric Kintail; market instructive.

runners.comment: Recorded a modest RPR at Market Rasen but looks open to progress
runners.name: Lady Boujee
runners.spotlight: Shaped promisingly in finishing second of seven at Market Rasen (2m, good to soft); recorded a modest RPR but represents major yard and looks open to progress.

runners.comment: Sibling to two winners for her stable, notably smart jumper Millers Bank
runners.name: Skye Glance
runners.spotlight: Sibling to two winners for her stable, notably Millers Bank (smart 2m-2m4f hurdle/chase); potentially a nice type but is bred for jumps.

runners.comment: Bred to do well in bumpers; kept on from rear in Newbury event
runners.name: Roxy Russet
runners.spotlight: Bred to do well in bumpers; only seventh of 12 at Newbury (2m, good to soft) but showed promise in keeping on from rear; open to improvement.

13:05.race_name: Midnite A Next Generation Betting App Apprentice Handicap

runners.comment: Bagged a Class 5 event in clearcut style over C&D last week; respected
runners.name: Sams Hope
runners.owner: D Morgan And K J Parris
runners.spotlight: Bagged a Class 5 event in clearcut style over C&D last week, making it four wins from her last seven starts; better than ever and commands respect under 5lb penalty back down in grade.

runners.comment: Far from solid on his form for current yard; 0-17 on AW
runners.name: Honour Your Dreams
runners.spotlight: Has defied higher marks on turf; however, far from solid on his form for current yard and two defeats this winter bring AW record to 0-17.

runners.comment: Form figures of 222 in maiden/novice races this winter; possibilities
runners.name: Thecoffeepoddotco
runners.spotlight: Record is 0-12 but she's threatening to get off the mark, having posted form figures of 222 in maiden/novice events this winter; possibilities on belated handicap debut.

runners.comment: Needs to rebound, having finished last in December hat-trick attempt
runners.name: Twilight Madness
runners.owner: P R Hedger & P C F Racing Ltd
runners.spotlight: C&D scorer much earlier in career; however, starts his 2026 campaign needing a rebound, having dropped away and finished last when bidding for December hat-trick over 6f.

runners.comment: Both wins at Newcastle; failed to beat a rival in last two runs
runners.name: Cast No Shadow
runners.spotlight: Gained both wins at Newcastle in 2024; failed to beat a rival there in last two starts during a light 2025 campaign; drops in class but doesn't look the percentage call.

runners.comment: Runner-up off 3lb higher in this race last year; in the mix
runners.name: Level Up
runners.spotlight: 12-time winner, most recently at Chelmsford in October; inconsistent since but is well capable of being involved; runner-up off 3lb higher in this race last year.

runners.comment: Back up only 2lb for Wolverhampton win; may remain competitive
runners.name: Papa Dont Preach
runners.spotlight: Generally consistent 2025 campaign culminated in Wolverhampton success (5f); back up only 2lb and Donovan Goucher takes off 7lb; has a modest strike-rate but may remain competitive.

runners.comment: Never figured over 5f last time but this drop back in grade may help
runners.name: Neptune Legend
runners.spotlight: Record of 1-6 for current yard, the win over 6f at Wolverhampton; never figured in Class 5 returned to 5f last time but this drop back in grade may help.

13:40.race_name: Bet £10 Get £40 With BetMGM Handicap (Div I)

runners.comment: Has made the frame in two Class 5 events for new yard, latest over C&D
runners.name: Dream Illusion
runners.spotlight: Record is only 1-16 but she's in form, having made the frame in two Class 5 events for new yard, latest over C&D; possibilities dropped back in grade.

runners.comment: Current mark reflects a general decline in his form for present stable
runners.name: Habrdi
runners.owner: Mrs S D Pearson And Mrs R Carr
runners.spotlight: No win since 2023 and current mark reflects a general decline in his form for present stable; hopes rest on the drop to Class 6 making a difference.

runners.comment: Maiden who has posted solid results since wearing headgear; fighting chance
runners.name: Sanditon
runners.spotlight: Still a maiden but has posted solid results (332) over 7f at Lingfield since wearing cheekpieces/visor; fighting chance provided he's in similar form switched to blinkers.

runners.comment: Place claims judged on best form this winter, including a C&D effort
runners.name: Cill Mocheallog
runners.spotlight: Gained sole win in Ireland in 2024; however, has place claims judged on best form this winter, including a third-place finish over C&D on penultimate start.

runners.comment: Scored four times early last year; ran encouragingly latest start
runners.name: Cloch Nua
runners.spotlight: Record of 6-29 on AW includes four wins early last year; best effort since returning from a break when fourth at Newcastle last time; in the mix.

runners.comment: Not solid on her handicap form; posted best novice effort over C&D
runners.name: Fast Bullet
runners.spotlight: Still a maiden and not particularly solid on her handicap form; however, posted best novice effort in sole C&D attempt; return to this scenario is the angle with her.

runners.comment: Hindered by wide trip last time; encouraging efforts otherwise for new yard
runners.name: Gundogan
runners.spotlight: Hindered by wide trip at Kempton last time; encouraging efforts otherwise for new stable and, while record is only 1-24, current mark looks very workable; one to consider.

runners.comment: Poor claims on his form for current stable
runners.name: Rogue Soldier
runners.spotlight: Well treated on historical data but holds poor claims on his form for current yard.

runners.comment: Form in December suggests she could go well with blinkers refitted
runners.name: Chloes Courage
runners.spotlight: Below par in visor last time but could go well with blinkers refitted; three attempts in this headgear, all in December, featured a win at Chelmsford and close second at Lingfield.

runners.comment: Needs to step up on this year's classified efforts
runners.name: Embarked
runners.spotlight: Just one success in a busy 2025 campaign; needs to step up on the form he's shown in a couple of Southwell classified events this year.

14:15.race_name: Bet £10 Get £40 With BetMGM Handicap (Div II)

runners.comment: Four-time AW winner; returns from eight weeks off on a dangerous mark; respected
runners.name: Rusheen Boy
runners.spotlight: Four-time AW winner, the latest off 1lb higher last August; ended 2025 with a couple of solid runs at 1m and dropping back in trip won't hurt; in the mix.

runners.comment: Not at best of late but the return of cheekpieces could be the catalyst for a better run
runners.name: Simply Blue
runners.spotlight: He hasn't quite found his best form since joining James Owen and his latest Chelmsford effort was disappointing; hopes appear to rest on the return of cheekpieces giving him a lift.

runners.comment: C&D win last February; string of good runs since August; in the shake up once again
runners.name: Bomb Squad
runners.spotlight: C&D winner last February off a 2lb lower mark; string of good performances since returning to action last August and he should be in the thick of it once again.

runners.breeder: Mrs S Field Miss S Field & Mr A Turbitt
runners.comment: Ran OK last time without convincing that he needed 7f; eyeshield tried today
runners.name: Act Of Violence
runners.spotlight: Unable to justify favouritism on his stable debut at Wolverhampton in November; excuse next time and although he ran respectably at Wolverhampton last month, it wasn't a run that conclusively proved his stamina for 7f; now tried in an eyeshield.

runners.comment: 16th time lucky when winning over C&D this month; still feasibly weighted up 3lb
runners.name: Operation Gimcrack
runners.spotlight: Off the mark at the 16th attempt when winning a C&D handicap 19 days ago; up 3lb but a couple of good efforts off this mark on turf last year; high on the list.

runners.comment: C&D win this month on 2nd run for new yard; fair 4th since; now tried in headgear; chance
runners.name: Moyowasi
runners.spotlight: Successful at the second time of asking for his new stable when keeping on well to win a C&D handicap 19 days ago; not seen to best effect at Newcastle last week but doubt he is handicapped out of things and in-form trainer now turns to cheekpieces.

runners.comment: C&D win off this mark last October; not so good since & this race demands a personal best
runners.name: Ardaddy
runners.spotlight: C&D winner (0-55 company) last October off this mark; not replicated that form in four runs since and needs to deliver a personal best to win.

runners.comment: C&D winner last February off 1lb lower; running OK over 6f of late; needs more back at 7f
runners.name: Flash The Dash
runners.spotlight: Often slowly away, as when winning over C&D last February; three 6f runs since October have all been creditable and the step back up in trip could give him a lift.

runners.comment: Placed over C&D last year but balance of his form suggests he is up against it
runners.name: Six Of Diamonds
runners.spotlight: His only placed effort came over C&D last September; perhaps needed this month's return from 80 days off but others arrive with more compelling claims.

14:50.race_name: Read Meg Nicholl's Blog At betmgm.co.uk Classified Stakes (Div I)

runners.comment: Solid effort over C&D last week on reappearance and classified debut; respected
runners.name: American Rose
runners.spotlight: Record is only 2-29 but she posted a solid effort over C&D last week on reappearance and classified debut, beating all bar one who was on the middle leg of a hat-trick; respected.

runners.comment: Went close in most recent classified attempt; major player at the weights
runners.name: Autumn Angel
runners.spotlight: Both starts this year over 6f at Wolverhampton, going close in classified contest then hindered by wide trip in handicap; major player at the weights and has won over C&D.

runners.comment: Still a maiden but this drop to 0-50 classified level may have positive effect
runners.name: Bella Love
runners.spotlight: Placed several times but still a maiden and has weak claims on her handicap form since returned to AW; however, this drop to 0-50 classified level may have positive effect.

runners.comment: Has lacked consistency but starts his 2026 season in a suitable grade/location
runners.name: Brother Dave
runners.spotlight: Completed a C&D double (classified/handicap) in March 2024; has lacked consistency since but starts his 2026 campaign in a very suitable grade/location.

runners.comment: Form has stagnated for current stable; yet to be placed
runners.name: Darlas Secret
runners.spotlight: Remains a maiden and form has stagnated for current stable; ran below market expectations in sole classified attempt and yet to be placed.

runners.comment: Placed in similar event over C&D last week; never involved in 1m handicap here on Tuesday
runners.name: Evoluir
runners.spotlight: Classified form includes a success at Wolverhampton last February and third-place finish over C&D last week; lesser effort in 1m handicap here on Tuesday but he's capable of being involved back at this level.

runners.comment: Has achieved little at novice level and brings the worst form
runners.name: Lowestoft
runners.spotlight: Has achieved little at novice level and brings the worst form; best watched unless the market suggests a bigger effort is likely.

runners.comment: Defeat on Tuesday took her AW record to 0-26
runners.name: Shesashambles
runners.spotlight: Came up short in similar event at Newcastle on Tuesday, taking AW record to 0-26; gained sole turf success in 2024.

runners.comment: Ties in with American Rose on reappearance form over C&D last week
runners.name: Wrath Of Hector
runners.spotlight: Three-time winner at Southwell much earlier in career; poor strike-rate in last few years but ties in with American Rose on reappearance form over C&D last week.

15:25.race_name: Read Meg Nicholl's Blog At betmgm.co.uk Classified Stakes (Div II)

runners.comment: Two wins in the first half of 2025; looked a hard ride when sixth over C&D last week
runners.name: Anificas Beauty
runners.spotlight: Won twice over further in the first half of 2025; ridden prominently in a similar event here last week but having hit the front 3f out, she threw her head about before weakening into sixth; capable but risky.

runners.breeder: Highclere Stud & Mr Ilyas Emir Karadag
runners.comment: 100-1 and well held twice this month; too much to prove for comfort
runners.name: Barneys Bay
runners.spotlight: Well beaten in three runs since returning from a summer break, the last two coming this month; hard to recommend.

runners.comment: Exposed maiden but placed over C&D last week and he holds each-way claims once again
runners.name: Captain Pickles
runners.spotlight: 0-17 but he ran well for third in a similar race over C&D last week; should give it another good go.

runners.comment: Good 3rd over 5f on penultimate start; less good over 6f last time; chance if at her best
runners.name: Isla Bella
runners.spotlight: Ran well when third of eight at Wolverhampton in December (5f) but failed to build on it over 6f in a classified race at Chelmsford two weeks ago; stays 7f and dangerous if near her best.

runners.comment: Runner-up at this level on her last two starts; strong claims in this line up
runners.name: Laurens Dream
runners.spotlight: Losing run stands at 18 but she has run well in 7f classified events on Tapeta on her last two starts, the latest here last week; strong claims in this field.

runners.comment: Two good runs at Lingfield (1m) this winter; solid claims if getting it right at the start
runners.name: Royal Jet
runners.spotlight: Successful in a 1m handicap at Lingfield on his penultimate start and similar form when third back there ten days ago; can get it wrong at the start which is a slight concern back down in trip but he comes here with more to recommend him than many.

runners.comment: 19-race maiden; fair third at Chelmsford last week but needs to raise her game a notch
runners.name: Tootsie
runners.spotlight: 0-15 for Tim Easterby and beaten four times for new stable since December 29; latest effort was a bit better but she will need to raise her game again to take this.

runners.comment: Good 2nd at Lingfield before Christmas but disappointed twice since; rare 7f run today
runners.name: World Of Darcy
runners.spotlight: Offered hope of a revival when second to a gambled-on winner at Lingfield before Christmas but his two runs since have been well short of that level; rare 7f run today.

16:00.race_name: Make The Move To Midnite Handicap

runners.breeder: Mount Coote Stud And Anthony Warrender
runners.comment: 3-3 since upped to 2m; ran well over C&D prior to that hat-trick; progressing well on AW
runners.name: Nunc Est Bibendum
runners.spotlight: Record of 3-3 since upped to 2m, most recently scoring readily at Lingfield last week; incurs 5lb penalty but Jude Fernandes takes off 7lb; ran well over C&D prior to the hat-trick; progressing well on AW and commands respect.

runners.comment: May show progress now handicapping, albeit it's needed to defy his opening mark
runners.name: Geordie Mackem
runners.owner: The Cat And The Mag Partnership
runners.spotlight: Record of 0-3 in bumpers and 0-3 on Flat but has bits of encouraging form; may show progress now handicapping, albeit it's needed to defy his opening mark.

runners.breeder: His Highness The Aga Khans Studs S C
runners.comment: Ran below market expectations in last Flat attempt; competitively treated on best form
runners.name: Simiyann
runners.spotlight: Returns to the Flat after two heavy defeats over hurdles; ran below market expectations on last attempt under this code but is competitively treated on best AW/turf form.

runners.comment: Faded into third behind Nunc Est Bibendum last week but may fare better back down in trip
runners.name: Prince Quattro
runners.owner: Ursa Major Ltd & Hicky Parmar Racing
runners.spotlight: Faded into third behind Nunc Est Bibendum at Lingfield last week but may make the rematch tighter over this shorter distance; has gone close a couple of times on the Flat, suggesting he can add to his hurdles wins.

runners.comment: Good spell early last year featured a C&D win off 4lb higher; 3-6 at Southwell overall
runners.name: Further Measure
runners.spotlight: Best recent effort when fourth to Nunc Est Bibendum on worse terms at Lingfield on penultimate outing; good spell early in 2025 featured a C&D success off 4lb higher; 3-6 at Southwell overall; interesting back here, despite his advancing years.

runners.comment: Switch to handicap level and first-time hood are possible sources of improvement
runners.name: Not So Sobers
runners.spotlight: Bumper winner who is 0-5 over hurdles; not solid on his Flat form but this switch to handicap level and first-time hood are possible sources of improvement.

runners.comment: Could go well but she remains out of the winning habit (losing spell goes back to 2023)
runners.name: Fleur De Mer
runners.owner: Mr & Mrs G F Hall Racing
runners.spotlight: Has made the frame several times for current yard, including at Wolverhampton (1m6f) latest start; could go well but she remains out of the winning habit (losing spell goes back to 2023).

runners.comment: Record of 2-3 since wearing cheekpieces; may have more to offer in the retained headgear
runners.name: Arc Zoosve
runners.spotlight: Maiden prior to his record of 2-3 (over 2m) since wearing cheekpieces, just holding on at Lingfield most recently; gives the impression he'll be as effective back down in trip; may have more to offer in the retained headgear; shortlisted.

runners.comment: Hinted at a revival last time but isn't the percentage call back down in trip
runners.name: Zephlyn
runners.spotlight: All wins over 2m, including three times last spring; out of form since until hinting at a revival last time; doesn't look the percentage call back down in trip, however.

16:35.race_name: Midnite Aint Your Grandad's Bookie Handicap

runners.comment: Latest effort suggests this return to 1m3f is worth exploring; possibilities
runners.name: Silkies Sib
runners.spotlight: Ex-Irish 6yo who scored at Wolverhampton (9.5f) on third start for new yard; modest third at Chelmsford (1m2f; wore cheekpieces) since but shaped as if this return to 1m3f is worth exploring; possibilities if taking well to visor.

runners.comment: Has largely encouraging form since handicapping; solid second last time
runners.name: Alfred Spero
runners.spotlight: Eight-race maiden who has largely encouraging form since handicapping, solid second at Newcastle (12.5f; behind subsequent winner) most recently; enters calculations off same mark.

runners.comment: Posted three duck eggs last year for new stable
runners.name: Abu Royal
runners.spotlight: Recorded sole win in 2023; posted three duck eggs last year for new stable; best watched unless the market suggests a revival is likely.

runners.comment: 0-14 on AW but was a good second on most recent attempt in this sphere
runners.name: Mrs Meader
runners.spotlight: Veteran who is a four-time winner on turf; 0-14 on AW but was a good second at Chelmsford on most recent attempt in this sphere; absent since September.

runners.comment: Ran respectably in first-time visor over C&D most recently; in the mix
runners.name: Night Bear
runners.spotlight: Has a better strike-rate on turf than on AW but ran respectably in first-time visor over C&D most recently; similar effort would give him frame possibilities in the retained headgear.

runners.comment: Holds weak claims on her form for new yard
runners.name: Very Classy
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced 6yo who holds weak claims on the form she showed last year for new yard; ruled out unless the market speaks positively.

runners.comment: Inconsistent but this reappearance may be the time to catch her
runners.name: Ring Fenced
runners.spotlight: Inconsistent sort but she was placed over C&D in the first of her two starts last year, which offers hope for a big effort on reappearance; three years since sole win, however.

runners.comment: Shaped encouragingly last time but not sure to back up that effort
runners.name: Broadstone
runners.spotlight: Still a maiden and inconsistent for current stable; shaped quite encouragingly in C&D classified event most recently but isn't guaranteed to back up that effort.

runners.comment: Modest sixth over C&D on reappearance but may fare better this time
runners.name: Bond Spirit
runners.spotlight: Modest sixth in similar event over C&D on reappearance, extending his losing run, but may fare better with the outing under his belt; scored twice at Southwell in 2023.

runners.comment: New trip needs to make a big difference
runners.name: Stoneacre
runners.spotlight: Ten-race maiden whose form claims are far from solid; failed to beat a rival in 1m classified contest at Southwell on reappearance; new trip needs to make a big difference.

runners.comment: Very weak claims on form
runners.name: Easter Sundae
runners.spotlight: Similar type to Stoneacre, being 0-10 and holding very weak claims on form; second start back from lengthy absence.

runners.comment: First-time headgear needs to have major effect
runners.name: Wadacre Moriarty
runners.spotlight: Four-race maiden whose form has got progressively poorer; well beaten in C&D classified event most recently; first-time headgear needs to have major effect.

17:10.race_name: Midnite Are Upping The Betting Game Maiden Stakes (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Has something to find on his Wolverhampton 7f efforts
runners.name: Hammal
runners.spotlight: Has something to find on his two efforts at Wolverhampton (7f) over a year apart.

runners.comment: Perhaps needed the run at Southwell (7f) on belated debut
runners.name: Highfield Jewel
runners.spotlight: 4yo filly; perhaps needed the outing at Southwell (7f) on belated debut but is less interesting than some of the 3yos in this field.

runners.comment: Last of nine at Kempton in sole start for Richard Hannon
runners.name: Elashgar
runners.spotlight: Needs a big step forward, having finished last of nine at Kempton (7f) in sole start for Richard Hannon; sold for 2,500gns since.

runners.comment: Represents notable connections and may still do better
runners.name: Foxtrot Flyer
runners.spotlight: Represents notable connections; showed some promise in small field at Newcastle (6f) in September, then had gelding operation; lesser effort over C&D on reappearance but may still do better.

runners.comment: Open to improvement with Lingfield effort under his belt
runners.name: Grey Force
runners.spotlight: Finished 6l fourth at Lingfield (6f) where he was one of two newcomers in a field of six and seemed to need the outing/experience; reasonable to expect improvement.

runners.comment: Ties in with Space Moon on Newcastle running last time
runners.name: Kameko Fever
runners.owner: Richard Fahey Ebor Racing Club Ltd
runners.spotlight: Failed to beat a rival over 5f on debut; fared better upped to 6f at Newcastle and has frame possibilities provided that form, which ties him in with Space Moon, is backed up.

runners.comment: Has made the frame in two C&D events; solid contender
runners.name: Mr Juggles
runners.spotlight: Solid contender on form, having made the frame in two C&D contests, and is bred to do better still, being related to a couple of winners for his stable; respected.

runners.comment: Fourth at Lingfield last time; one of the main players
runners.name: Tactical Blitz
runners.spotlight: Unraced at two; couple of starts already this year, better effort when fourth at Lingfield (6f) latest; may take another step forward; one of the main players.

runners.comment: Newcomer whose dam landed a gamble on debut; check betting
runners.name: Y Y Star
runners.spotlight: Newcomer by Zoustar and first foal of a 5f 2yo winner (including Listed; RPR 95) for his stable; said dam landed a gamble on debut; market support would heighten interest.

runners.comment: Looks one for handicaps shortly
runners.name: Blueaway
runners.spotlight: Showed some ability at Southwell last time but needs another step forward; may be more interesting in handicaps shortly.

runners.comment: Belied her 66-1 odds with third of ten at Newcastle
runners.name: Space Moon
runners.spotlight: Belied her 66-1 odds with third of ten, beaten about 8l, in 6f event at Newcastle; possibilities provided that promise is confirmed and normal progress occurs.

runners.comment: Plenty to find on the figures
runners.name: What A Tahoo
runners.owner: Richard Fahey Ebor Racing Club Ltd
runners.spotlight: Twice-raced filly who has plenty to find on the figures; handicaps more suitable soon.

17:40.race_name: Midnite, Building The Future Of Betting Handicap

runners.comment: 0-7 on the AW but was close up over C&D a month ago after undergoing wind surgery
runners.name: Albert Cee
runners.spotlight: Dual turf winner who is 0-7 on the AW but was close up over C&D a month ago after undergoing wind surgery; did hang under pressure then but hard to dismiss.

runners.breeder: Airlie Stud & Mrs S M Rogers
runners.comment: A maiden who continues to struggle despite hurtling down the weights; back in trip here
runners.name: Reddeef
runners.spotlight: A maiden who continues to struggle despite hurtling down the weights; reverting to sprinting could help matters but not the solid option here.

runners.breeder: Patrick Cosgrove & Lope De Vega Synd
runners.comment: Left Michael Bell for 3,000gns; will do well to win this off current mark after a layoff
runners.name: Pure Artistry
runners.spotlight: 1-11 for Michael Bell, the win coming over this trip on turf last summer off 5lb lower; below that level on final two runs for that yard and sold on for 3,000gns in December; will do well to win this off current mark after a layoff.

runners.comment: Remains a maiden and comfortably held in three runs for this yard; the hood is new
runners.name: Fort Augustus
runners.spotlight: Remains a maiden and comfortably held in three runs for this yard, over 6f on three different AW tracks; plenty to prove in the new hood.

runners.comment: All AW wins have been at Newcastle; losing run is mounting up; blinkers return
runners.name: Swiss Ace
runners.spotlight: All AW wins have been at Newcastle and he was only ninth there before finishing in the same position here earlier this month; losing run is mounting up; blinkers return.

runners.comment: All three AW wins have come at Chelmsford but a close second on Tapeta last time out
runners.name: Thank The Lord
runners.spotlight: All three AW wins have come at Chelmsford but was a close second on Newcastle's Tapeta in December (5f) and this dual 6f winner should have some say.

runners.comment: Continued to be competitive off this sort of mark since December's win at Wolverhampton
runners.name: Profit Street
runners.spotlight: 1-7 since joining James Owen; 6lb higher than for the win at Wolverhampton (6f) but has continued to be competitive and has solid claims once more.

runners.comment: Placed over Wolverhampton's 6f last time and Rab Havlin takes over from a 7lb claimer
runners.name: Initial Blue
runners.spotlight: AW winner for Richard Hannon; very disappointing debut for this yard here over 7f but ran better to hit the frame at Wolverhampton (6f) and Rab Havlin takes over from a 7lb claimer.

runners.comment: Only 2-37 and over two years since his last win; worth taking on
runners.name: Rambuso Creek
runners.spotlight: Only 2-37 and over two years since his last win; worth taking on despite another drop in the weights; cheekpieces return.

runners.comment: Close second at Kempton (6f) in December and ran okay to be fifth of ten here 18 days ago
runners.name: Hint Of The Jungle
runners.spotlight: Close second at Kempton (6f) in December and ran okay to be fifth of ten here 18 days ago (hood removed, as today); each-way claims.

runners.comment: Back to form despite a troubled run at Wolverhampton and she's won twice here
runners.name: Back Tomorrow
runners.owner: N J Dalgarno & W R Ellis
runners.spotlight: Completed a Wolverhampton hat-trick around this time last year and returned to form with a close fourth there 16 days ago despite a slow start and hitting some traffic; has won twice here so needs considering.

runners.comment: C&D winner; recent respectable runs have been over 8.6f/7f
runners.name: Supernova Steps
runners.spotlight: Only 1-19 but the win came over C&D in late 2024 and recent respectable runs have been over 8.6f/7f (in an eyeshield latterly); could have a say with Jack Dace taking off 5lb.

12:20.race_name: William Hill Racing Price Boosts Juvenile Hurdle (Go North Night Nurse Series Qualifier) (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Runner-up in Grade 2 at Chepstow and leading claims now back down in grade under penalty
runners.name: Klycot
runners.spotlight: French Flat winner who scored at Exeter (2m, heavy) last month on his second hurdle start before 7l second of five in Grade 2 at Chepstow (2m, good to soft); leading claims now back down in grade under a 7lb penalty.

runners.comment: Won in good style in France on debut then sold for £100,000; could have a big say
runners.name: Vivre Le Reve
runners.owner: Burns P & M Morrall Stokes & Wicks
runners.spotlight: Won in good style on debut in French 3yo hurdle (heavy) in November and sold for £100,000 later that month; has joined a good yard for his British career and could have a big say under a 7lb penalty.

runners.comment: Fair maiden on the Flat but soundly beaten on both starts in this code
runners.name: Ashdown Forest
runners.spotlight: Fair maiden on the Flat for whom it is still early days over hurdles; however, he's been soundly beaten on both starts in this code and needs a sizeable step forward today.

runners.comment: Ran okay at Musselburgh on second hurdle start but others have achieved considerably more
runners.name: Canavan
runners.spotlight: 0-6 on the Flat and failed to progress; ran okay when sixth of ten at Musselburgh (1m7f, good to soft) on New Year's Day on his second hurdle start but others have achieved considerably more.

runners.comment: Displayed some promise in sole bumper but well beaten on last month's hurdle debut
runners.name: Captain Connor
runners.spotlight: Displayed some promise when third on debut in bumper at Huntingdon (2m, good to soft) in November and he's open to improvement on this second hurdle start; however, he was well beaten at 22-1 over hurdles at Catterick (1m7f, good to soft) last month and has to leave that form miles behind.

runners.comment: Hurdle debut win at Warwick; now takes on males but could have more to offer in this code
runners.name: Cloaks Of Gold
runners.spotlight: Went very close to getting off the mark on final Flat start in October (1m5f, AW) and went one better on hurdle/stable debut at Warwick (2m, good to soft) last month; now carries a penalty against males but she could have more to offer in this code; possible player.

runners.comment: Behind when running out two out on debut in November and soundly beaten at 50-1 since
runners.name: Dontelimurnamepike
runners.spotlight: Behind when running out two out on debut at Doncaster in November and soundly beaten at 50-1 there (also 2m on good to soft) since.

runners.comment: Didn't run badly when fifth at Musselburgh on stable debut but plenty to find today
runners.name: Glenridding
runners.spotlight: Modest Flat winner who didn't run badly when fifth of ten at Musselburgh (1m7f, good to soft) three weeks ago on his stable debut and second hurdle start; however, he has plenty to find today.

runners.comment: Pulled hard when tailed off on hurdle debut; a hood goes on; promise on sole Flat start
runners.name: Knighton
runners.spotlight: Pulled hard and jumped to the right when tailed off on hurdle debut at Doncaster (2m, good to soft) last month; however, the first-time hood could help him settle and he showed promise when second of four in September on his sole Flat start (1m4f, good); not written off for last year's winning yard.

runners.comment: Promising second on last month's hurdle debut at Taunton and is in good hands to progress
runners.name: My Kinda Ghaiy
runners.spotlight: 0-6 on the Flat but displayed ability and there was also promise in last month's hurdle/stable debut at Taunton (2m, good), where he was runner-up to a useful (but sadly ill-fated) prospect; in good hands to progress and he could have a part to play.

runners.comment: Dam won twice at top level on Flat but he didn't achieve much on his two runs in that code
runners.name: Treasure Islands
runners.spotlight: His dam won twice at the top level on the Flat but this fellow didn't achieve much on his two runs in that code; now goes hurdling.

runners.comment: Regressive maiden on the Flat and tailed off at 50-1 over C&D on last month's hurdle debut
runners.name: Twilight Safari
runners.spotlight: Regressive maiden on the Flat and tailed off at 50-1 over C&D (soft) on last month's hurdle debut; a hood goes on.

12:50.race_name: Bowel Cancer Screening Programme Saves Lives EBF "National Hunt" Novices' Hurdle (Qualifier) (GBB)
