runners.comment: Point runner-up who won on hurdle debut; drops in trip but respected nevertheless
runners.name: Kakas Cousin
runners.spotlight: Changed hands for £160,000 after being short-headed in Irish maiden point (3m, yielding) and won at even-money on last month's hurdle debut at Catterick (2m3f, good); drops in trip today but respected nevertheless.

runners.comment: Won by 5l over C&D on hurdle debut then found Grade 1 company too much; leading candidate
runners.name: Starmount
runners.spotlight: Point winner who made all by 5l on hurdle debut over C&D (soft) last month; found the Grade 1 Formby Novices' Hurdle too much at Aintree (2m1f, good to soft) last time but he's a leading candidate now back down in grade.

runners.comment: Ability in bumpers but not enough to suggest he'll be making an impact on hurdle debut
runners.name: Bogha Baiste
runners.owner: A Lee J Matterson D Mullen & Partner
runners.spotlight: Showed ability on both bumper starts (2m/1m7f, good) but not enough to suggest he'll be making an impact on this hurdle debut.

runners.breeder: S C E A Ecurie La Grugerie Et Al
runners.comment: Ran well in sole bumper and this half-brother to 2 h'dle winners could give a good account
runners.name: Hourman
runners.spotlight: 10-1 when fourth of five in blanket finish on debut in bumper at Hexham (2m, good) in October; he's a half-brother to two hurdle winners and could give a good account on his first run in this sphere.

runners.comment: Well beaten on all three starts; dramatic improvement needed now in a tongue-tie
runners.name: Je Mr Dawson
runners.spotlight: Well beaten in sole bumper and same story when big odds for first two hurdle starts; dramatic improvement needed now in a tongue-tie.

runners.comment: Big odds and well beaten at Ayr in a bumper and maiden hurdle
runners.name: Johnny Two Jets
runners.spotlight: Big odds and well beaten at Ayr in a bumper and maiden hurdle.

runners.comment: Tailed off last March on sole h'dle start; interesting to see what the market makes of him
runners.name: Jungle Jet
runners.spotlight: Mixed form among his five (winless) point starts and absent since tailed off on hurdle debut at Hexham last March; however, he was just 11-2, he's had wind surgery since, and his stable has been enjoying an excellent season; interesting to see what the market makes of him on his return.

runners.comment: Went close in Carlisle bumper in October but soundly beaten on both hurdle starts
runners.name: Knockeranna Rose
runners.spotlight: Went close in a bumper at Carlisle (2m1f, good) in October but soundly beaten last month on first two hurdle starts (2m4f/2m, heavy/good to soft) and he needs to raise his game in a big way.

runners.comment: Runner-up in sole bumper then merely mid-division on hurdle debut; may be best watched
runners.name: Largy Meadow
runners.spotlight: 12l second on debut in bumper at Ballinrobe (1m7f, good) last July; failed to settle when soundly beaten at 33-1 on recent hurdle/stable debut at Ayr (2m, soft); the hood might help but he may be best watched for now.

runners.breeder: V Adenot & P Adenot & F Vannereux
runners.comment: Has shown some promise in a point and a bumper and he's an each-way possible
runners.name: Laristote
runners.spotlight: In contention before final-fence fall on debut in Irish maiden point (3m, yielding) last February, and last month's 12l third of five on bumper debut at Sedgefield (2m1f, soft) wasn't without promise; open to improvement and he's an each-way possible on his first hurdle start.

runners.comment: Bumper winner; not at same level yet over hurdles but might be able to run into a place
runners.name: William Yeats
runners.spotlight: Soft-ground bumper winner; hasn't threatened on first two hurdle starts (2m3f/2m, good to soft) and something to find with the principals here, but he might be able to run into a place.

runners.comment: Hasn't posed a serious threat when fourth in a junior bumper and a juvenile hurdle
runners.name: Big Love
runners.spotlight: Hasn't posed a serious threat when fourth in a junior bumper (2m, good) and a juvenile hurdle (2m, good to soft), and others are preferred.

13:20.race_name: William Hill Each Way Extra Handicap Chase (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Two-time heavy-ground hurdle; improving and looks a big player back up in trip.
runners.name: Pleasington
runners.spotlight: Low mileage on the clock for this two-time heavy-ground hurdle winner who is improving; close third on his chase debut here (1m7f, soft); still in it at Aintree next time (2m4f, soft) when a mistake two out cost him; career-best effort latest at Newbury (2m; good); big player back up in trip.

runners.comment: Multiple staying hurdle winner; handy mark if revived but has a bit to prove at present.
runners.name: Johnsons Blue
runners.spotlight: Multiple winner of staying hurdles; arrives on the back of lacklustre efforts both over hurdles and, more recently, fences; on a handy mark if revived but he's got a fair bit to prove at present.

runners.comment: 2m4f chase winner (soft) on penultimate start; pulled up latest; player if bouncing back.
runners.name: Fine Casting
runners.spotlight: Bumper, hurdle and chase winner at up to 2m4f; acts on slow ground; often races prominently, as he did when winning at Bangor (2m4f, soft) in November; now 6lb higher, as was the case when he was pulled up at Newbury latest, when his jockey felt something was amiss; player if bouncing back.

runners.breeder: Exors Of The Late Michael Lysaght
runners.comment: Four-time chase winner at up to 2m1f; close 2m4f second latest; unexposed over this trip.
runners.name: Doyouknowwhatimean
runners.spotlight: Four-time chase winner at up to 2m1f (good and heavy) when with Dan Skelton; improved on that when a close second in a five-runner Uttoxeter chase (2m4f, heavy) under a 7lb claimer latest; up 1lb and without a claimer, he may find it tougher but he's unexposed over this trip.

runners.comment: Showed signs of a return to form last month and should be competitive; each-way player.
runners.name: Walk On Quest
runners.spotlight: Completed a four-timer over fences (2m-2m5f, slow ground) last season before the handicapper caught up; showed signs of a return to form at Newcastle (2m4f, good to soft) last month and should be competitive; each-way player.

runners.comment: Both chase wins have been here; up 3lb for latest; not ruled out but hard to be confident.
runners.name: Genois
runners.spotlight: 2-23 over fences (both wins here) and was easy enough to back before his staying-on win over C&D (soft) on Boxing Day; the handicapper has given him a chance of a repeat by putting him up just 3lb; not ruled out but his overall profile doesn't fuel confidence.

runners.comment: Two 2m4f chase wins before a poor jumping display latest; player if back on track.
runners.name: Hello Judge
runners.spotlight: Began his campaign with 2m4f wins at Carlisle (good) and Hexham (good to soft); largely consistent but his jumping lacked fluency when well beaten at Newcastle (2m4f, good to soft) latest; drops 1lb; likely contender if he can get back on track.

runners.comment: Returned from wind surgery with a respectable third at Haydock and is not ruled out.
runners.name: Ned Tanner
runners.spotlight: Four-time chase winner from 2m4f-2m7f, mostly on soft; back below his last winning mark again; returned from wind surgery with a respectable third at Haydock and is not ruled out.

runners.comment: Won this last year when 2lb higher; hard to predict but is not written off.
runners.name: Geryville
runners.spotlight: Dual C&D winner (slow ground) who is 2lb lower than when winning this race last year; has been back here on all four starts this season, the best of those being his second one, when just over 1l second to Issam; well below that level either side of it; hard to predict but not written off.

13:55.race_name: William Hill Racing Bet Builder Handicap Hurdle (Go North Cab On Target Series Qualifier)

runners.comment: Went close on handicap debut at Carlisle last April but three lesser runs have followed
runners.name: Caramelo Rapido
runners.spotlight: Went close on handicap debut at Carlisle (2m1f, good) last April and now 3lb lower, but three lesser performances have followed (2m3f/2m4f, good/good to soft) and she needs to turn things around.

runners.comment: Placed in cheekpieces on last two starts; in the mix if taking to the first-time visor
runners.name: Forest Blaze
runners.owner: M Blades Craggs Clark And Cambridge
runners.spotlight: Two wins at Hexham (2m4f, soft/good to soft) last season and he's run well to be placed in cheekpieces at Ayr on his last two starts (2m3f/2m4f, heavy/soft); in the mix if taking to the first-time visor.

runners.comment: Placed in a 3m point and open to improvement now up in trip on handicap debut
runners.name: Sweeper System
runners.spotlight: 6yo who has improved with each of his three runs in novice hurdles, finishing third at Southwell (2m, good to soft) last month; placed in a 3m point and open to improvement now up in trip on handicap debut.

runners.comment: Bumper winner for whom the step back up in trip could be a plus on handicap debut
runners.name: Suspected
runners.spotlight: Bumper winner (2m, good) who is yet to get competitive over hurdles but shaped when fourth at Kelso (2m, good to soft) last month as though this step back up in trip will be a plus on his handicap debut; possible player.

runners.comment: Sedgefield in November was a step back in the right direction but she needs another today
runners.name: Reel Rosie
runners.spotlight: On a reduced mark and she took a step back in the right direction at Sedgefield in November in this headgear combination, but she was still soundly beaten in third and needs to build on that effort today.

runners.comment: Returns from absence but is on a competitive mark if retaining his ability; watch market
runners.name: Ionity
runners.spotlight: Ran some solid races when switched to handicaps in 2024; missed all of 2025 but is on a competitive mark if retaining his ability; watch the market.

runners.comment: Placed twice in a row in autumn 2024 and well treated on that form but slim pickings since
runners.name: Knacker Trapper
runners.spotlight: Placed twice in a row in autumn 2024 and well treated on that form but it's been slim pickings since; may be best watched back from a break.

runners.comment: Runner-up in bumper on debut in April 2024 but he's struggled subsequently
runners.name: River Rider
runners.spotlight: Runner-up in bumper on debut in April 2024 but he's struggled subsequently; a major turnaround is necessary in a first-time tongue-tie.

runners.comment: Hasn't shone on last few starts; handy mark to work with on first run for new yard
runners.name: Ruler Legend
runners.spotlight: Runner-up on the Flat for Declan Carroll in October, then didn't really shine over hurdles on final few starts for that yard; however, he has a reduced mark to work with on his first run for Gary Hanmer, who has enjoyed plenty of success with stable-switcher Heeztheboy this season.

runners.comment: Made all at Uttoxeter then held in third there next time, but today's conditions may help
runners.name: Eric Carmen
runners.spotlight: Won at Bangor (2m1f, heavy) last February and easily made all under Benjamin Macey at Uttoxeter (2m4f, heavy) last month; he finished held in third there (2m, good to soft) 12 days later but the step back up in trip and forecast slower ground could prompt a bigger performance today.

runners.breeder: Herve Robert & Mrs Adeline De Vitton
runners.comment: Inconsistent and a return to form is needed but he won this race two years ago
runners.name: Goguenard
runners.spotlight: Inconsistent last season and well beaten on both outings this term; however, he may have needed his latest run in November and won this two years ago; not written off.

runners.comment: 4yo who stays well on the Flat and today's extra distance could be right up his street
runners.name: Toby Two Scoops
runners.spotlight: 4yo who is 0-9 on the Flat and 0-4 over hurdles but he's been showing promise in this code and kept on for third of 11 in handicap against older horses here (2m, soft) four weeks ago; stays well on the Flat and today's extra distance could be right up his street.

runners.comment: Well beaten in a bumper and three novice hurdles, and same story on handicap/chase debut
runners.name: Diamond Trilogy
runners.spotlight: Well beaten in a bumper and three novice hurdles, and it was the same story on his handicap/chase debut at Sedgefield in November.

runners.comment: Third of ten off this lowly mark at Carlisle on handicap debut; might not be far away
runners.name: Wor Lad
runners.spotlight: Having not achieved much previously, he made his handicap debut off this lowly mark at Carlisle (2m1f, soft) last month and finished third of ten, beaten just under 8l; this unexposed 6yo might not be far away.

runners.comment: Makes handicap hurdle debut; poor 1-26 strike-rate on the Flat and others appeal more
runners.name: Mythical
runners.spotlight: Today's handicap hurdle debut provides him with a first realistic opportunity in this code; however, he has a poor 1-26 strike-rate on the Flat and makes his stable debut after some time off; others appeal more.

runners.comment: Produced a couple of fair performances in final third of last year but remains a maiden
runners.name: Perfect Arch
runners.spotlight: Produced a couple of reasonable performances in the final third of last year but without threatening, and this 9yo is a longstanding maiden.

14:30.race_name: William Hill Racing Daily Winnings Boost Mares' Handicap Chase (Challenger Mares' Chase Qual) (GBB)

runners.comment: Has struggled after long absence but well treated on old hurdle form and not written off
runners.name: Politacus
runners.spotlight: Returned from long absence with two appearances towards the end of last year and has been well beaten/pulled up, most recently on her chase debut at Uttoxeter; something to prove but she's well handicapped on her hurdle form up to spring 2024 and it's too soon to write her off.

runners.comment: Completed hat-trick on chase debut; weakened quickly next time but has had wind op since
runners.name: She Is For Me Boys
runners.spotlight: Point winner who won two novice hurdles (2m1f/2m3f, good) prior to completing the hat-trick on her chase/handicap debut at Kempton (2m4f, good) in November; weakened quickly at Cheltenham (2m4f, good to soft) last month and has something to prove on slow ground, but she's had wind surgery since and this lightly raced 7yo could bounce back with a big performance.

runners.comment: Well beaten on chase debut at Musselburgh but progressive over hurdles previously
runners.name: Mountain Molly
runners.spotlight: Point winner who won a novice hurdle at Kelso (2m4f, good) in September and went close in a handicap there (2m4f, soft) next time; awkward at the first fence and reportedly never travelling when well beaten on chase debut at Musselburgh last month, which is a concern, but she retains potential.

runners.comment: Makes chase debut on second run back from long absence; chance if tapping into old ability
runners.name: Dontyawantme
runners.spotlight: Never got into it on stable debut over hurdles at Newcastle last month; however, that was her first outing since March 2024 and she may have needed it; this point, bumper and novice hurdle winner could go well on her first chase start if tapping back into her old ability.

runners.comment: A return to form is needed but she's on a handy mark and has had a wind op; check betting
runners.name: Taxus Baccata
runners.spotlight: Below par on final few runs for Matt Crawley, the latest in November, and sold for 7,000gns last month; however, she's on a handy mark judged on her good chase form last March and makes her stable debut in a first-time tongue-tie having had wind surgery; could stage a revival; watch the betting.

runners.comment: Won over 2m4f in November on reappearance then didn't see out 3m last time; back in trip
runners.name: Celestial Fashion
runners.spotlight: Built upon last season's chasing promise to win on reappearance at Carlisle (2m4f, soft) in November; faded into fourth of 14 when upped to 3m at Ayr (soft) last time and could have a big say now back down in trip.

15:05.race_name: William Hill Best Odds Guaranteed Handicap Hurdle (Go North Brindisi Breeze Qualifier) (Div I)

runners.comment: Triple staying hurdle winner; handy mark and may do better now stepping back up in trip.
runners.name: Evenwood Sonofagun
runners.owner: Mrs D Chapman & Mrs E Quinlan
runners.spotlight: Triple winner of staying hurdles (good and good to soft); now 3lb lower than the most recent of those, last May; arguable that his last two starts have been over too short and he may be seen to better effect now there's a greater emphasis on stamina.

runners.comment: In the doldrums since back-to-back chase and hurdle wins at around 3m last February.
runners.name: Asa
runners.spotlight: Best efforts were in back-to-back chase (3m1f, good to soft) and hurdle (3m, good to soft) wins last February; has been in the doldrums since but remains higher than any winning mark; fair bit to prove at present.

runners.comment: 2m7f hurdle winner; pulled up latest; less testing ground may help; not ruled out.
runners.name: Wee Alki
runners.spotlight: Broke his duck at the 11th attempt when staying on well at Hexham (2m7f, good to soft) on his penultimate start; lacklustre effort when pulled up back there (heavy) latest; less testing ground may help him to bounce back; not ruled out.

runners.comment: Point winner; unplaced under rules but step up in trip looks positive; possible improver.
runners.name: Slievehill
runners.spotlight: Dual point winner who is unplaced in four starts under rules, the last three over an inadequate-looking 2m; marked step up in trip should help so may see some improvement now.

runners.comment: Placed in three hurdles at around 3m; not ruled out from this competitive mark.
runners.name: La Higuera
runners.spotlight: Placed in his last three starts, all on slow ground at around 3m and in cheekpieces; hasn't been able to find enough at the end of his races but is not ruled out from what is clearly a competitive mark.

runners.comment: Best form was on her penultimate start; one to consider if forgiving her latest effort.
runners.name: Superior Glance
runners.spotlight: Only seven rules races, despite her advancing years, and she could be a player here if back in the form of her penultimate start, when a 2l third at Hexham (2m7f, heavy); quickly backed out at Uttoxeter latest but if forgiving her that, she's one to consider with the champion jockey booked.

runners.comment: Dual hurdle winner at around 3m; back in better form latest and could be involved.
runners.name: Bollin Matilda
runners.spotlight: Dual hurdle winner at around 3m on soft; took a step back in the right direction at Musselburgh latest (3m, good to soft), when a close third; could be involved.

runners.comment: Hasn't inspired in four starts (unseated early latest); workable mark but has it to prove.
runners.name: De Deli Counter
runners.spotlight: Hasn't inspired in his four starts to date and unseated early on his handicap debut at Newcastle latest; workable mark but has it to prove.

runners.comment: 2m6f winner; below that level otherwise; plenty to prove after her two starts in December.
runners.name: Moveonbuy
runners.spotlight: 2m6f winner (soft) at Cartmel last summer but some way below that level on her other six starts; plenty to prove again after her two efforts in December.

runners.comment: 0-11 and was 21l second at Hereford (3m1f, soft) latest; others make greater appeal.
runners.name: Smart Bucks
runners.spotlight: 0-11 and was 21l adrift in second at Hereford (3m1f, soft) latest; others make greater appeal.

15:40.race_name: William Hill Best Odds Guaranteed Handicap Hurdle (Go North Brindisi Breeze Qualifier) (Div II)

runners.comment: Dual soft-ground 3m hurdle winner; step back in right direction latest; likely player.
runners.name: Clondaw Royale
runners.spotlight: Twice a soft-ground hurdle winner at up to 3m; lost his way last season and had slipped to a handy mark and was supported before taking a step back in the right direction at Haydock (3m, good) latest; likely player from the same mark.

runners.comment: 2m3f course winner (soft); two competitive efforts before disappointing latest.
runners.name: Farmer Jimmy
runners.owner: J Scarrow I Barker & S Turner
runners.spotlight: 2m3f course winner (soft) last winter, when 3lb lower; disappointed at Uttoxeter latest but had preceded that with two competitive efforts; needs to bounce back.

runners.comment: Landed a hat-trick and strong claims of making it a four-timer if over Monday's exertions.
runners.name: Bollin Thou
runners.spotlight: Progressive 8yo who has won at Uttoxeter (2m7f, good to soft), Hereford (3m1f, soft) and Lingfield (2m3f, soft) on his last three starts; carries a double penalty going back up in trip; in great form and if he's over Monday's exertions, he still looks ahead of the handicapper.

runners.comment: 2m6f hurdle winner (soft); best effort over C&D (good) last March; bit to prove again.
runners.name: Ballin Bay
runners.spotlight: 2m6f hurdle winner (soft) for Pauline Robson; peak effort came on debut for this trainer (C&D, good) last March; bit to prove again after failing to complete on his reappearance last November; 5lb claim could help.

runners.comment: 2m4f and 3m hurdle winner; up 4lb for latest success but could eke out more; contender.
runners.name: You Did
runners.spotlight: In better form on his last three starts, winning at Hexham (2m4f, good) and more recently Musselburgh (3m, soft), with a good effort at Market Rasen (2m7f, good to soft) separating them; up another 4lb but may be able to eke out more and he's a contender.

runners.comment: Point winner; second on her rules debut but has struggled since; others preferred.
runners.name: Theatre Light
runners.spotlight: Point winner who was runner-up in a Carlisle maiden hurdle (2m3f, good) on her rules debut but has struggled since; others preferred.

runners.comment: 3m hurdle winner who has gone off the boil this season; handy mark; big revival needed.
runners.name: Glory Hights
runners.spotlight: 3m hurdle winner (good to soft) last season, form that he managed to better on a couple of occasions; appears to have gone off the boil this season; big revival needed now back on a handy mark and in first-time headgear.

runners.comment: Improved effort (2m3f) at Huntingdon latest and may do better now up in trip; visor tried.
runners.name: Cuillin Ridge
runners.spotlight: 0-5 over hurdles; still early days in handicaps and improved when 8l fourth at Huntingdon (2m3f, good to soft) last month; step up in trip looks positive and he may be able to do better still; visor goes on.

runners.comment: On a more workable mark now; if handling softer ground, he could get more competitive.
runners.name: King Casey
runners.spotlight: Well held in two starts since a break but he is beginning to slip to a more workable mark now; if handling softer ground than of late, he may be able to get more competitive.

runners.comment: Not written off after C&D third but will have to improve to win this from 2lb wrong.
runners.name: Fancy Nancy Pants
runners.spotlight: Moderate mare who was placed for the first time in a big-field C&D handicap (soft) last month; not written off after that but will have to improve on it to win this from 2lb wrong.
